author: Rick Stein
name: Clams with Beer, Black Beans and Ginger
ingredients:
- 1.75 kg carpetshell clams
- 1 tbsp fermented salted Chinese black beans, rinsed
- 1 tsp white sugar
- 2 tbsp sesame oil
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 20g garlic, finely chopped
- 25g ginger, finely shredded
- 1 medium hot red chilli, thinly sliced
- 120 ml lager
- juice of 1/2 lime
- 6 spring onions, thinly sliced
- Handful of coriander leaves, roughly chopped
instructions:
- Wash the clams well in fresh water. Put the salted black beans, sugar and sesame oil into a small bowl and mash into a course paste with a spoon.
- Heat the vegetable oil in a large, deep pan over a medium-high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, chilli and black bean paste and stir-fry for about 10 seconds. Then add the clams and beer, turn up the heat to high, cover and cook for abourt 3 minutes, shaking the pan every now and then, until all the clams have opened.
- Uncover the pan, add the lime juice and spring onions and mix well. Serve with coriander scattered on top.
